org.apache.beam.sdk.util.common

Class Counter<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.beam.sdk.util.common.Counter<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of values aggregated by this counter

    public abstract class Counter<T>
extends Object
    A Counter enables the aggregation of a stream of values over time. The cumulative aggregate value is updated as new values are added, or it can be reset to a new value. Multiple kinds of aggregation are supported depending on the type of the counter.

    Counters compare using value equality of their name, kind, and cumulative value. Equal counters should have equal toString()s.

    After all possible mutations have completed, the reader should check isDirty() for every counter, otherwise updates may be lost.

    A counter may become dirty without a corresponding update to the value. This generally will occur when the calls to addValue(), committing(), and committed() are interleaved such that the value is updated between the calls to committing and the read of the value.

    • Method Detail

      • ints

        public static Counter<Integer> ints(CounterName name,
                                    Counter.AggregationKind kind)
        Constructs a new Counter that aggregates Integer, values according to the desired aggregation kind. The supported aggregation kinds are Counter.AggregationKind.SUM, Counter.AggregationKind.MIN, Counter.AggregationKind.MAX, and Counter.AggregationKind.MEAN. This is a convenience wrapper over a Counter implementation that aggregates Long values. This is useful when the application handles (boxed) Integer values that are not readily convertible to the (boxed) Long values otherwise expected by the Counter implementation aggregating Long values.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the new counter
        kind - the new counter's aggregation kind
        Returns:
        the newly constructed Counter
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the aggregation kind is not supported

      • ints

        @Deprecated
public static Counter<Integer> ints(String name,
                                                Counter.AggregationKind kind)
        Deprecated. use ints(CounterName, AggregationKind).
        Constructs a new Counter<Integer> with an unstructured name.

      • longs

        public static Counter<Long> longs(CounterName name,
                                  Counter.AggregationKind kind)
        Constructs a new Counter that aggregates Long values according to the desired aggregation kind. The supported aggregation kinds are Counter.AggregationKind.SUM, Counter.AggregationKind.MIN, Counter.AggregationKind.MAX, and Counter.AggregationKind.MEAN.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the new counter
        kind - the new counter's aggregation kind
        Returns:
        the newly constructed Counter
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the aggregation kind is not supported

      • booleans

        public static Counter<Boolean> booleans(CounterName name,
                                        Counter.AggregationKind kind)
        Constructs a new Counter that aggregates Boolean values according to the desired aggregation kind. The only supported aggregation kinds are Counter.AggregationKind.AND and Counter.AggregationKind.OR.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the new counter
        kind - the new counter's aggregation kind
        Returns:
        the newly constructed Counter
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the aggregation kind is not supported

      • addValue

        public abstract Counter<T> addValue(T value)
        Adds a new value to the aggregation stream. Returns this (to allow method chaining).

      • resetToValue

        public abstract Counter<T> resetToValue(T value)
        Resets the aggregation stream to this new value. This aggregator must not be a MEAN aggregator. Returns this (to allow method chaining).

      • resetMeanToValue

        public abstract Counter<T> resetMeanToValue(long elementCount,
                                            T value)
        Resets the aggregation stream to this new value. Returns this (to allow method chaining). The value of elementCount must be non-negative, and this aggregator must be a MEAN aggregator.

      • getAndResetDelta

        public abstract T getAndResetDelta()
        Resets the counter's delta value to have no values accumulated and returns the value of the delta prior to the reset.
        Returns:
        the aggregate delta at the time this method is called

      • getAndResetMeanDelta

        public abstract Counter.CounterMean<T> getAndResetMeanDelta()
        Resets the counter's delta value to have no values accumulated and returns the value of the delta prior to the reset, for a MEAN counter.
        Returns:
        the mean delta t the time this method is called

      • getFlatName

        public String getFlatName()
        Returns the counter's flat name.

public String getName()
        Deprecated. use getFlatName().

        public Counter.AggregationKind getKind()

        public Class<?> getType()
        Returns the counter's type.

      • getAggregate

        public abstract T getAggregate()
        Returns the aggregated value, or the sum for MEAN aggregation, either total or, if delta, since the last update extraction or resetDelta.

      • getMean

        @Nullable
public abstract Counter.CounterMean<T> getMean()
        Returns the mean in the form of a CounterMean, or null if this is not a MEAN counter.

      • isDirty

        public boolean isDirty()
        Returns if the counter contains non-committed aggregate.

      • committing

        public boolean committing()
        Changes the counter from CommitState.DIRTY to CommitState.COMMITTING.
        Returns:
        true if successful. False return indicates that the commit state was not in CommitState.DIRTY.

      • committed

        public boolean committed()
        Changes the counter from CommitState.COMMITTING to CommitState.COMMITTED.
        Returns:
        true if successful.

        False return indicates that the counter was updated while the committing is pending. That counter update might or might not has been committed. The commitState has to stay in CommitState.DIRTY.

      • setDirty

        protected void setDirty()
        Sets the counter to CommitState.DIRTY.

        Must be called at the end of addValue(T), resetToValue(T), resetMeanToValue(long, T), and merge(org.apache.beam.sdk.util.common.Counter<T>).

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the Counter. Useful for debugging logs. Example return value: "ElementCount:SUM(15)".
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object o)
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object

      • isCompatibleWith

        public boolean isCompatibleWith(Counter<?> that)
        Returns whether this Counter is compatible with that Counter. If so, they can be merged into a single Counter.

      • merge

        public abstract Counter<T> merge(Counter<T> that)
        Merges this counter with the provided counter, returning this counter with the combined value of both counters. This may reset the delta of this counter.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided Counter is not compatible with this Counter

      • illegalArgumentException

        protected IllegalArgumentException illegalArgumentException()
        Constructs an IllegalArgumentException explaining that this Counter's aggregation kind is not supported by its value type.
